LOBL.content: I slice barbarously, illegitimately, as we always do, counting on implicit contract, impossible contract, that you’ve read “everything,” that you know the whole corpus by heart at every moment, w/ living heart that beats unceasingly (sans arrêt), w/out pulsation
LOBL.linkedContent: I slice barbarously, illegitimately, as we always do, counting on implicit contract, impossible contract, that you’ve read “everything,” that you know the whole corpus by heart at every moment, w/ living heart that beats unceasingly (sans arrêt), w/out pulsation

LOBL.content: economy: stricture not coupure [pre-capitalist machine?], always external constraint that arrests a text in general, i.e. anything, for example life death
LOBL.linkedContent: economy: stricture not coupure [pre-capitalist machine?], always external constraint that arrests a text in general, i.e. anything, for example life death

MSUBJ.content: van Gogh did not paint ghosts, he reperspired nature, made it sweat, awful elementary pressures of commas [arrêt], scratches > now we see them too in the world
MSUBJ.linkedContent: van Gogh did not paint ghosts, he reperspired nature, made it sweat, awful elementary pressures of commas [arrêt], scratches > now we see them too in the world

A.content: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof
A.linkedContent: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof

PP.content: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself

PAS.content: Blanchot makes a laughing stock (fait rire) of the opposition btwn clarification (explicitation) and cut (coupure) > l’éclat de rire
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot makes a laughing stock (fait rire) of the opposition btwn clarification (explicitation) and cut (coupure) > l’éclat de rire

P.content: Kant’s beauty [wild tulip] requires absolute interruption: straining toward end w/out goal, not pure if cut can be bandaged (pansable), no pure cut (if it could be prolonged, completed, supplemented), no beauty > everything in it straining toward the bout (end, blow)
P.linkedContent: Kant’s beauty [wild tulip] requires absolute interruption: straining toward end w/out goal, not pure if cut can be bandaged (pansable), no pure cut (if it could be prolonged, completed, supplemented), no beauty > everything in it straining toward the bout (end, blow)

P.content: this fascination w/out desire, in view of an end never in view, a but en blanc [“point blank”] > interrupted finality must show itself as finality & interrupture, as edging
P.linkedContent: this fascination w/out desire, in view of an end never in view, a but en blanc [“point blank”] > interrupted finality must show itself as finality & interrupture, as edging

P.content: it is the sans that counts for beauty, la bordure [edging] en sans de la coupure pure
P.linkedContent: it is the sans that counts for beauty, la bordure [edging] en sans de la coupure pure

P.content: death’s essential relation to the cut, the hiatus of the abyss, where beauty takes us by surprise
P.linkedContent: death’s essential relation to the cut, the hiatus of the abyss, where beauty takes us by surprise

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete
P.linkedContent: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente
P.linkedContent: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente

P.content: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut
P.linkedContent: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut

POS.content: incision of deconstruction (not voluntary decision, not absolute beginning) occurs along lines of force, forces of rupture, that are localizable in discourse to be deconstructed
POS.linkedContent: incision of deconstruction (not voluntary decision, not absolute beginning) occurs along lines of force, forces of rupture, that are localizable in discourse to be deconstructed

ROP.content: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien
ROP.linkedContent: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien

ROP.content: how can the cut be the tie itself? how can the link be the interruption?
ROP.linkedContent: how can the cut be the tie itself? how can the link be the interruption?

SP.content: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]
SP.linkedContent: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]

O.content: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction ——coupe claire, coupe définitive, coupe à tire et à aire [different ways to clear out trees]
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction ——coupe claire, coupe définitive, coupe à tire et à aire [different ways to clear out trees]

O.content: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)
O.linkedContent: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)

O.content: mise en jeu sans prélude, de ce qui reste à préparer d’un coup [no prelude for all the coups]
O.linkedContent: mise en jeu sans prélude, de ce qui reste à préparer d’un coup [no prelude for all the coups]

O.content: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre
O.linkedContent: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre

SW.content: [re: laser] this radiance requires two parallel mirrors perpendicular to cutting rays (like in nature, double mirror w/ 2 voices)
SW.linkedContent: [re: laser] this radiance requires two parallel mirrors perpendicular to cutting rays (like in nature, double mirror w/ 2 voices)

SW.content: braid of phonemes (verdict, voix, vouloir, le voir, la venue, etc.) is knotted out of sight, remains, like warp of text, untranslatable > language we inherit is never ours, which is why it can’t be translated: put it outside its self, no longer recognize its children/idiom [baby daddy]
SW.linkedContent: braid of phonemes (verdict, voix, vouloir, le voir, la venue, etc.) is knotted out of sight, remains, like warp of text, untranslatable > language we inherit is never ours, which is why it can’t be translated: put it outside its self, no longer recognize its children/idiom [baby daddy]

SW.content: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)
SW.linkedContent: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)

Gii.content: for Heidegger, philosophy & science never attain the parallelism, the cutting/breaching (into one another), of thinking/philosophy (Denken) & poetry (Dichten)
Gii.linkedContent: for Heidegger, philosophy & science never attain the parallelism, the cutting/breaching (into one another), of thinking/philosophy (Denken) & poetry (Dichten)

REST.content: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)
REST.linkedContent: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)

DST.content: perhaps désister marks nothing negative, perhaps dé- does not determine -ister (-ester, ist, est: exist, subsist, consist), but dislodges it radically (this aradical root -ister) [cf. LI p. 159n]
DST.linkedContent: perhaps désister marks nothing negative, perhaps dé- does not determine -ister (-ester, ist, est: exist, subsist, consist), but dislodges it radically (this aradical root -ister) [cf. LI p. 159n]

DST.content: signature interrupts, or rather marks w/ incision, the fold along which metaphysical ontomimetology is destined to divide, desist [ontomimetology in Plato, Aristotle, Hegel, Heidegger, and more surreptitiously in Nietzsche, Freud, Lacan]
DST.linkedContent: signature interrupts, or rather marks w/ incision, the fold along which metaphysical ontomimetology is destined to divide, desist [ontomimetology in Plato, Aristotle, Hegel, Heidegger, and more surreptitiously in Nietzsche, Freud, Lacan]

RM.content: Derrida attempted to regulate use of word recouper in Glas
RM.linkedContent: Derrida attempted to regulate use of word recouper in Glas

TR.content: oeuvre as trace implies structure of sur-vival, what cuts the oeuvre off from the operation, cut assures archival independence, quasi-machinelike autonomy: iterability, power of repetition
TR.linkedContent: oeuvre as trace implies structure of sur-vival, what cuts the oeuvre off from the operation, cut assures archival independence, quasi-machinelike autonomy: iterability, power of repetition

TR.content: machine is cut as well as cutting re: living present of life, living body > machine as much effect as cause of cut
TR.linkedContent: machine is cut as well as cutting re: living present of life, living body > machine as much effect as cause of cut

TR.content: cut: wounding, opening, chance of a respiration

PSSS.content: btwn performative institution and constative knowledge an absolute hiatus, absolute cut, structure of indirectness, hiatus like a mouth that speaks or wound that bleeds [cruor]
PSSS.linkedContent: btwn performative institution and constative knowledge an absolute hiatus, absolute cut, structure of indirectness, hiatus like a mouth that speaks or wound that bleeds [cruor]

PSSS.content: this discontinuity calls for a leap, what Classical humanist philosophers call freedom, this interruption gives a chance
PSSS.linkedContent: this discontinuity calls for a leap, what Classical humanist philosophers call freedom, this interruption gives a chance

D.content: Soller: toujours cette marge, cette coupure, mince immensité latente
D.linkedContent: Soller: toujours cette marge, cette coupure, mince immensité latente

D.content: every term depends on place [in?] machine—entrained into an ordered series of cuts
D.linkedContent: every term depends on place [in?] machine—entrained into an ordered series of cuts

D.content: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte
D.linkedContent: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte

D.content: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing
D.linkedContent: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing

D.content: to present oneself, to stand upright (se dresser), always a murder, a castration > an erection that can only display itself in play, laughter, pointed teeth of cut
D.linkedContent: to present oneself, to stand upright (se dresser), always a murder, a castration > an erection that can only display itself in play, laughter, pointed teeth of cut

D.content: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)
D.linkedContent: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)

D.content: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering
D.linkedContent: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering

D.content: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect
D.linkedContent: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect

D.content: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)
D.linkedContent: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)

D.content: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]
D.linkedContent: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]

+R.content: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first
+R.linkedContent: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first

+R.content: [re: Adami] detailing of extracts, fragments detachable as signatures (typewriter, pen case, umbrella, spectacles, etc.) > why de-tail [dé-tailler: cut out]?
+R.linkedContent: [re: Adami] detailing of extracts, fragments detachable as signatures (typewriter, pen case, umbrella, spectacles, etc.) > why de-tail [dé-tailler: cut out]?

LI.content: coupure intervenes moment there’s a mark, its positive condition of emergence, it is iterability itself, that which is remarkable in mark, re- of repeated, re- of repeating, condition/effect of iterability, merges w/ it, cuts across (recoupe) iterability, cutting the cut/break in remark
LI.linkedContent: coupure intervenes moment there’s a mark, its positive condition of emergence, it is iterability itself, that which is remarkable in mark, re- of repeated, re- of repeating, condition/effect of iterability, merges w/ it, cuts across (recoupe) iterability, cutting the cut/break in remark

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

TN.content: operation that inscribed some touching in all writing, surg-ical, Greek cheirourgia, cheir (hand), ergon (work) > even if machines/technology are indispensable
TN.linkedContent: operation that inscribed some touching in all writing, surg-ical, Greek cheirourgia, cheir (hand), ergon (work) > even if machines/technology are indispensable

NOY.content: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)
NOY.linkedContent: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)

NOY.content: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)

NOY.content: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”
NOY.linkedContent: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”

ATM.content: for Levinas, interruption puts an end to the authority of the Said, the thematical, dialectical, the same, the economical
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, interruption puts an end to the authority of the Said, the thematical, dialectical, the same, the economical

ATM.content: Levinas describes how the enveloping continuum or tissue of the State, the dialectic, etc., preserves itself by cutting out interruptions and retying/maintaining itself in suppressing them: Levinas reties cut threads (not continuous ones): this is the trace of his diachrony, trace of discontinuity
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas describes how the enveloping continuum or tissue of the State, the dialectic, etc., preserves itself by cutting out interruptions and retying/maintaining itself in suppressing them: Levinas reties cut threads (not continuous ones): this is the trace of his diachrony, trace of discontinuity

ATM.content: since interruption is not a cut but logic of ab-solute de-stricturation, since it is reappropriable: to insist on the hiatus, the series is necessary > series has no single knot, but knots a multiplicity of retied knots (noeuds re-noués)
ATM.linkedContent: since interruption is not a cut but logic of ab-solute de-stricturation, since it is reappropriable: to insist on the hiatus, the series is necessary > series has no single knot, but knots a multiplicity of retied knots (noeuds re-noués)

ATM.content: opening of interruption is never pure
